results.title: Sister Forsythe's casebook
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Outlines the work done by a school community nurse in early detection of potentially serious health problems in students. Shows diagnosis of petit mal, child abuse, depresion resulting from overweight, bed wetting, poor coordination. Notes how the school nurse works in conjunction with parents and techers.

results.title: Sisal
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and East African Railways and Harbours Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the cultivation and treatment of sisal, a raw material for rope making, in Tanganyika. Shows the way in which the leaves are removed from the sisal plant and conveyed to the decorticator machine; also the drying, grading, brushing and baling of the fibre. Illustrates the uses of the fibre; traces the history of the industry in East Africa and mentions problems associated with growth, processing and marketing.

results.title: Siroseeder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Siroseeder is a machine designed to spray a herbicide, cultivate the soil in narrow rows, insert seed and fertilizer at a predetermined depth, replace the soil and press it down lightly. Normally. farmers could use four implements and make up to eight passes to do the same job. If these and other experiments are fruitful, inputs of time, labour and fuel will fall dramatically, as will the risk of soil erosion.

results.title: Sirocco
results.creator_credit: Curtis Bernhardt, Robert Lord and Santana Pictures
results.brief_description: Harry Smith (Humphrey Bogart) is a casino operator and underground gun runner supplying Arab insurrectionists with guns against the French in 1925 Damascus. His life is about to become even more complicated when he is arrested by the French, then approached by Colonel Feroud (Lee J. Cobb) for secret miliatary information - the reward, liberation from war-torn Damascus. Feroud and Smith become rivals when Smith becomes involved with the frenchman’s mistress, Violette (Marta Toren). The betrayal and violence that ensues causes Smith to question the morality of his actions and his life in Damascus.

results.title: Sirius puppy training with Dr. Ian Dunbar
results.creator_credit: Beth M Toth, Martin Bluford and Bluford-Toth Productions
results.brief_description: This video is the first comprehensive obedience, behaviour and temperament training program designed especially for puppies. Emphasising family participation, this video shows owners how to teach their puppy basic obedience commands such as “come”, “sit”, “heel”, and “stay”. Through daily handling and calming exercises, your puppy can also be taught to overcome biting, barking, and housetraining behavioural problems. The aim of the video is to train dogs to be good companions and a joy to live with.

results.title: Sirens
results.creator_credit: John Duigan, Sue Milliken, Sarah Radclyffe Productions-Sirens Limited, WMG Film, Samson Productions and British Screen Finance Limited
results.brief_description: Set in a small Australian town in the 1920s, “Sirens” is a light-hearted comedy written and directed by John Duigan (Flirting, The Year my voice broke). It is the (fictional) story of Australian artist Norman Lindsay (Sam Neill) who has raised the ire of the Church, with his erotically charged depictions of nude women. The Church regards his art as sinful, blasphemous and morally damaging. Lindsay is living on a large property in bohemian bliss with his wife (Pamela Rabe), children and models. An English preacher Anthony Campion (Hugh Grant) is sent to Lindsay’s property to try to dissuade him from continuing to paint and draw in his current style. Campion’s wife Estella (Tara Fitzgerald), who accompanies Anthony on this trip, is sexually frustrated and bored with her marriage. The sirens of the title (Elle Macpherson, Portia de Rossi and Kate Fischer) cavort semi-clad for much of their time at the artist’s house and studio, causing the sexual tension between Anthony and Estella, to rise. Estella experiences extensive erotic dreams featuring the sirens and various men she has encountered. “Sirens” features a famed scene where the five main women of the film are shown naked atop a mountain range. An Australian/United Kingdom co-production, also starring Ben Mendelsohn and John Polson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Duigan, Sue Milliken, Sarah Radclyffe Productions-Sirens Limited, WMG Film, Samson Productions and British Screen Finance Limited

results.title: Sirene
results.brief_description: Animated satire on present-day commercial life. Depicts a mermaid in the harbour of a modern city who is charmed by a young man playing a flute and attempts to flee with him, but the machines which surround the harbour destroy her. Interesting use of sound (contrast between the harshness of mechanical sounds, and the beauty of flute music), and the animation has a surreal quality that is quite effective.

results.title: Sir, you forgot to pay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Experience with numbers, dramatic play and concept formation are among the aims behind conducting a store in a classroom situation. Activities include experiment with barter, use of an adding machine and cash register, and the purchase of merchandise. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Sir! Sir!
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Here is what happened in a Toronto classroom when teachers occupied the children’s desks and children became the teachers. The film grew out of another, Mrs. Ryan’s Drama Class, where young children found their way into creative drama. There is food for thought in this impromptu reversal of roles.
